website_summaries.verdict: With a wide range of sizes available, there is a HEATIT cable for any circumstance.
pros: Safely turns on and off based on pipe temperature
LED light indicates when cable is in use
Cable is strong, but remains easy to work with
Can be easily attached to pipe with electrical tape or ties
Will keep water flowing even at -40-degree temperatures
cons: The non-heated section of the cable is short
You may need an additional extension cord

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the water flowing
customer_reviews.text: Living in a travel trailer, keeps water hose from freezing. Attach to hose with zip ties and insert into pipe insulation and secure with zip ties.
customer_reviews.author: John M

customer_reviews.title: We wrapped this around the hose to keep it from ...
customer_reviews.text: We wrapped this around the hose to keep it from freezing while camping. It kept the faucet from freezing as well as the hose. Worked down to about 20 degrees.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper Kim

customer_reviews.title: and the water in the line is just fine. I wrapped foam insulation sleeves around the pipe
customer_reviews.text: I've got this 60' tape wrapped around 3/4 PVC. It is outside in an open metal building. The pipe is a watering line for the chickens (automatic drinker cups attached ). We've had Temps down to 4 degrees here, and the water in the line is just fine. I wrapped foam insulation sleeves around the pipe, then completely covered in duct tape. Unfortunately, in some areas, the chickens have torn away that insulation. The heat tape is still keeping the water from freezing. Very pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Hypes

customer_reviews.title: It went down to 0 F and I never had ...
customer_reviews.text: It went down to 0 F and I never had a single issue with my water line, worked perfectly and is an extremely well made product. I would buy again without hesitation. I have this product covered with a single layer of insulation and the water line never froze. Was a bit of a pain to install due to the stiffness but that is just because it is so well made and robust.
customer_reviews.author: Dazcon5

customer_reviews.title: Working perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I used this heat tape to warm an outdoor yard hydrant that cannot be drained for winter weather. In the photo I added two layers of half inch closed cell foam pipe insulation tubes and wrapped the whole thing in a wind proof blanket. This product seems well made and up to the challenge, though winter has not really set in so far. Single digit temps expected here in Michigan. If the seller or manufacturer sees this review and thinks I am setting myself up for failure, I hope they will respond here.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Spangenberg

customer_reviews.title: Super item and saves frozen pipes
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect under my home. I get temps in the low teens or even below. Never had a frozen pipe like last year. I feel very safe with this running and the thermostat only operates in bone chilling weather
customer_reviews.author: Peter Wakefield

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Not a lot to say. Installed on a pvc waterline coming into and going through the garage. It turns in and keeps it from freezing. It's 1deg in Ohio right now.
customer_reviews.author: Boris

customer_reviews.title: I didn't use this for pipes, I placed it ...
customer_reviews.text: I didn't use this for pipes, I placed it in my driveway. Each spring, with freeze/thaw cycles in Alaska my driveway creates ice dams and eventually floods the garage - the heat cable kept a trench open.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: It is a great product, very effective
customer_reviews.text: I needed this after my pipes during a wicked cold snap. None of this to be found on 3 counties surrounding mine. But it arrived 2 days later and with a serviceman charge to unthaw them so we could keep them open with this and hard wire it to my panel, this product has kept my water moving. It is a great product, very effective.
customer_reviews.author: obnursiepoo

customer_reviews.title: Light went on but no heat!
customer_reviews.text: I'm still baffled as to what happened. I ordered 2 24' lengths and one 12' length. NONE of them worked! As the pic shows, "the light was on, but no one home"!! Light at socket plug worked, taped to pipe as per instructions, temperature guage showed 28.9 degrees so that's when I panicked, had to take all of them off the pipes they were supposed to KEEP FROM FREEZING and put in space heaters into the rooms to avoid pipe breakage! Very disappointed! How can 3 different brand new lengths of cable NOT work????
customer_reviews.author: 'eh what's that?

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: This is super easy to install and operate. I purchased this to keep our chicken's water from freezing during the winter. The temperatures have gotten down in the 20s and we've had freezing rain, snow and sleet. Through it all the HEATIT heating cable has kept the water flowing. With a variety of sizes you should be able to find one that suits your particular application.
customer_reviews.author: Dan D.

customer_reviews.title: Bad advertising -- won't take a chance...
customer_reviews.text: Description from seller states you can use on drainpipe, sewer, etc. Which is exactly why I purchased -- didn't want a 'poopsicle' at my Camper drains this winter at -20. Page 3 of instruction book secifically states DO NOT use on any pipe not filled with water... (see photo). So much for my drain lines.... Thanks for wasting my time Zhukeshi - you should read your own products' install manual before you advertise the exact opposite!
customer_reviews.author: Matt J

customer_reviews.title: Keep RV water supply from freezing.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to keep the water supply to my sons RV from freezing. They are staying in it until their house is built which seems to be taking all winter.. We taped it to the hose supplying water to the RV and put foam insulation around the whole thing and it has been working fine with out any problems.
customer_reviews.author: B. Siepak

customer_reviews.title: it does put off some heat but didn't keep my ...
customer_reviews.text: it does put off some heat but didn't keep my pipes from freezing in 20degF weather (rated to 14degF). I followed the instructions of wrapping the copper pipe with this, then fiberglass insulation. I actually put a second layer of fiberglass, and covered the faucet with a foam cover to make sure, but still froze. Get higher wattage for actual protection
customer_reviews.author: L. Smith

customer_reviews.title: You need to double the cable length
customer_reviews.text: If you use a single length of this cable, it only protects down to +20°F. There is a table in the pictures showing how much additional cable you have to use for protection at lower temps, or for larger pipes. It is 3W @ 38°F, with a max of 4W/ft. I returned it & bought an Easy Heat cable & it has protected down to 5°F so far with a single length. It also cuts off at a lower temp of 45°F vs 52.
customer_reviews.author: jcewl93

customer_reviews.title: It will stop working when you need it the most.
customer_reviews.text: The heat line worked for three. Weeks then quit. The water line going to the RV froze and caused thousands of dollars of damage to our RV water supply. Avoid like the plague!
customer_reviews.author: Gregory F. Cooper

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR PLASTIC DRAIN PIPES!!!!!!!! DO NOT BUY!!!! FALSE CLAIMS!
customer_reviews.text: They lied. This is not the real self-regulating heat tape like PSR1012. This has single point thermostat not every one foot. Will not work if there is no water in pipe. IT CANNOT BE OVERLAPPED ON ITSELF LIKE CLAIMED BECAUSE THERE IS ONLY ONE TEMPERATURE MEASURING POINT! Can not be used on furnace drain!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Heater hose stopped freezing
customer_reviews.text: We had temps down to 7 degrees (F) but this hose heater kept the end and fitting of our heater hose from freezing. NOTE, a heated water hose does not heat the first and last foot or so or the fittings. The first time I used my heated water hose the ends froze. Thus, the reason for buying this heater. It worked very well!
customer_reviews.author: LRM

customer_reviews.title: Great, one thing to watch out for...
customer_reviews.text: Be careful if plugging in two next to each other. The power indicator light is so bright, it can illuminate the neighboring plug making you think it's plugged in too.
customer_reviews.author: Alan B.

customer_reviews.title: Defective Units
customer_reviews.text: I purchased three cables from this brand, a six foot heating cable and two three foot heating cables. Of that order the six foot cable and one of the three foot cables did not work. I am so happy I tested these before I installed them. The three foot cable that works is working well but I won't by this brand again. Two out of three defective in the same order is just too much.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Camper septic line install
customer_reviews.text: Received in a timely manner with other items. We had snow on the ground so I plugged it in and buried the sensor. Later on the snow was slightly melted around the wire. I installed on a camper septic pipes and valves. Wrapped around the pipes, around the valves and covered with insulation. So far, it has kept the valves and pipes from freezing; however, the weather has only been 15 to 20 degrees at night, 30-40 degrees during the day. It has a light on the male plug which is lit whenever there is power to the plug. Does not necessarily mean the heat tape is on. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Test thermostat immersed in iced water for 15 minutes to check function.
customer_reviews.text: I gave two stars because of the prompt and easy return. I tested the heating cable in iced water per instructions on the sales page and the thermostat did not work.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: High quality, won’t burn anything, works great.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t get hot, just warm, even where it doesn’t touch anything, so it shouldn’t care if you have empty plastic pipes. I set it going by wrapping an ice pack on the thermostat (the only temperature contoller is about 6 feet from the plug, So make sure that’s outside). The whole length got warm, but no hot spots to worry about. It feels very durable and high quality.
customer_reviews.author: The big Lebowski

customer_reviews.title: Water tastes so much better
customer_reviews.text: Well, upon receiving it, it states to NOT attach directly to the hose. So cant use it. I wanted something that I could wrap my drinking water hose so that it wouldnt freeze during the winter..
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Wambach

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly on my 100ft water hose. Keeps hose from freezing. My RV has continual water during winter.
customer_reviews.author: David DeLeon

customer_reviews.title: doesn't work at all
customer_reviews.text: never got warm, even once. had setup outside on pipe with multiple nights of temps below 30 and nothing. even tested with ice pack around sensor (left on all night) and never got even slightly warm. waste of time setting up and a big disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Dee Harris

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: Tested it before installing, on a freezing surface and the tape did not get warm even after minutes. Have no confidence that it would work in practice.
customer_reviews.author: D. T. Neely

customer_reviews.title: Works for more then just pipes.
customer_reviews.text: I like that it is thermostat controlled and ramps up the power to meet the need. I used these last year to keep my gutters from totally freezing. Worked pretty well. This one I put under the outdoor portion of my heat pump to allow the water from the defrost cycle to drain away and not just freeze into a solid ice slick.
customer_reviews.author: J. Krutsch

customer_reviews.title: Very good, worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: Had a big ice dam at my new house, right over the front door. Chipped it out, then put this in there. Not even a single icicle after that. I rated install at 3 stars not because the manufacturer did anything, but because getting 20 feet up on a ladder to thread stubborn wire around gutter bolts is not exactly easy or safe.
customer_reviews.author: DVM

customer_reviews.title: It works well
customer_reviews.text: Used with a 25' stainless steel hose and insulated with foam tubes on my RV. We have had below freezing temperatures (mostly teens and single digit at night) for a month now without any issues. Wrapped a 12-foot version around the RV's water manifold as well.
customer_reviews.author: Vic

customer_reviews.title: HEATIT JHSF 6-feet 120V Self Regulating Pre-assembled Pipe Heating Cable
customer_reviews.text: Quit working after 10 min, made sure the end was snug tight over the coldest area, this is when we had -50f in Illinois.
customer_reviews.author: ebari

customer_reviews.title: Worthless.
customer_reviews.text: Junk. First night of below freezing temperatures and my water is frozen.
customer_reviews.author: _Mark McCabe______________________________________

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Been using it on a construction site - keeps the sewage holding tank and plumbing run to the tank above freezing in Maine. Been running consistently for 3 months, no issues. Infinitely better than shutting down the bathroom and using a porta-john.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Dow

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Worked great, I taped it to a 25' RV water hose ( not recommended in the instructions) and covered it with split foam insulation, it worked perfectly. I had enough at each end to protect the supply faucet,the RV connection, and the sewer valves.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Quinn

customer_reviews.title: I'd rather be safe than sorry about pipes and single digits.
customer_reviews.text: Thermostat built-in to cable. It will turn on at +32 degrees F. This is exactly what I wanted. I had a pipe freeze since it got so cold in one room, so I'm not taking any chances. I think this is for indoor use only.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer reporter

customer_reviews.title: Works in our COLD country.
customer_reviews.text: We've always had problems with pipes freezing, especially in the laundry room. After we wrapped the pipes with HEATIT heating cable, there's no more problem and a lot of peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: G.Glee

customer_reviews.title: Kept my pipes from freezing
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I got way to much. As per their recommended chart. Next time I will get less. Its ok though was able to tighten the loops and even wrap over it's self. Happy, happy, happy.
customer_reviews.author: sean s shelby

customer_reviews.title: well made
customer_reviews.text: The heat tape appears to be well made. It went on easily enough taping it into position using HVAC aluminum duct tape. Truth be told, however, I'm not sure if it works well or not. It's covered up in my well house and the weather hasn't been intensely cold so far this winter. So far so good though.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: The heating cable works as expected.
customer_reviews.text: I have a well and the pipes are exposed to the cold. The heating cable wrapped around the pipes works as advertised and the pipes have not frozen when the temperature dropped to 10 degrees.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Z

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: so glad i have this been using it 3 months this week in the teens wraped my 40 feet hose to the camper with ties and hose wraps from wallmart no probs auto comes on as needed , sweet
customer_reviews.author: randy

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't get very hot, Barely even Warm
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this last year in a 60 ft length to use on our RV pipes. Never really ever seemed to get hot enough to help much, and we had below freezing temperatures many nights. Will be searching for a better quality, as I just cut this one up and threw it in the garbage this spring!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No More frozen Pipe this year!
customer_reviews.text: Tired of my pipes freezing due to one difficult pipe on the outside of my house ... I live at a 3800 foot elevation. I get snow and below 30 degree weather. It works great on the pipe I have constant trouble with. I'm glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: frogjumper

customer_reviews.title: Working great so far
customer_reviews.text: Using this to keep a whole house water filter in the garage from freezing. Preliminary tests worked but we have yet to get below freezing in the garage.
customer_reviews.author: J. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Super product for pipes.
customer_reviews.text: Live in my 5th wheel. Ran this product alone water hose placed 1 inch foam installation around both and it really works. It gets cold in the mountains but this keeps the freezing away.
customer_reviews.author: James C. Lindsey Jr

customer_reviews.title: Rigid but worked fine
customer_reviews.text: I received a defective unit which I returned and received another quickly. It worked well with minimum turn around time.
customer_reviews.author: Bappy

customer_reviews.title: Works as prescribed.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install on PEX. Put it under the pipe and wrapped it with insulation. Temps were down to 11 degrees F and everything was flowing all night.
customer_reviews.author: Mstr Beekeeper

customer_reviews.title: So far,so good!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have this outside! My water tank is outside next to my well.I wrapped the pipes,and also have 2 light bulbs in a small building enclosing the two.We have been down to zero,or a little below.
customer_reviews.author: Just plain Quirky

customer_reviews.title: Price and functionality
customer_reviews.text: I use one of these on my main water hose on my Fith Wheel, I have been down to -5 with absolutely no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Claude McClain

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: this works ver well for my RV water hose on those cold nights
customer_reviews.author: catamountgirl

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: I use it wrapped around my RV fresh water line that runs from pedestal to RV helps warm the water coming into RV
customer_reviews.author: DEW

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice product that will save my well pump from freezing next year.
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: They arrived, pipes didn’t freeze, couldn’t test.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Don’t know if they work, pipes didn’t freeze yet.
customer_reviews.author: Cheesus

customer_reviews.title: worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: This worked great, and saved us frozen pipes for sure when the furnace failed to fire up overnight. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Eric n Amber

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Has been awesome this winter. Used on a small farm. Will by another for the other water spout.
customer_reviews.author: J.S.

customer_reviews.title: Good choice of cable lengths.
customer_reviews.text: Local stores out in a cold spell and wondering why floor traffic is decreasing. This was a life saver for my garage sink pipes in unusual 10F weather last winter.
customer_reviews.author: T. Sterne

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: Attached to a garden hose as we live in our RV year roundxwhile we build a house. Keep hose from freezing when 10 degrees out. We also wrapped our hose with pipe insulation
customer_reviews.author: Tracie

customer_reviews.title: Seems to do the job.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to keep the ice out of my rain gutter. I’ll know more when we have a lot of snow.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: This product delivers
customer_reviews.text: Wow. Incredibly effective. Exposed pex kept freezing solid. No more. I simply zip tied this to the pex and my troubles are over. I haven’t even put insulation back over the lines. No matter. Temps in the low teens could not freeze the lines. Very well made product.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Buckner

customer_reviews.title: Works excellent
customer_reviews.text: Very surprised at how well this keeps our water line warm enough to avoid freezing.
customer_reviews.author: Brewser

customer_reviews.title: Works better than the $180 heated water hose.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. We purchased this to wrap our water hose on the camper to keep it from freezing. It’s gotten down to single digits and it’s not frozen up yet.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: 👎🏻 JUNK! Hours of research & $100 GONE!
customer_reviews.text: Delivery was LATE! I PAID $16 FOR 3 day shipping. Thanks to the delay it left me (Single Mom of 2) FROZEN PIPES FOR ME! Bought 60ft heat tape after installing it 2 different times (hours 🤦🏻‍♀️) *** It NEVER WORKED!!!!!!! ***** It was a SUPER WAY TO START WINTER OFF 🤔🤬👎🏻
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Ann

customer_reviews.title: Taped this to the pipes under the house....
customer_reviews.text: Then covered with self-sealing pipe insulation. I live in Maine where -20F is a frequent occurance. Did the job!
customer_reviews.author: FingerusArthriticus

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: I used this to wrap my water lines out in the garage where it occasionally drops below freezing. Has worked fine for a few months now.
customer_reviews.author: Big W

customer_reviews.title: well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: havent got it installed yet, but looks like its very well made and cant wait for it to warm up a little to run my new pipe and heating cable with it..
customer_reviews.author: Bryan G.

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived ahead of schedule! Added to lines supplying water lines from well to Wayseer.Bus (FB). Works like a charm! No worries about freezing supply lines (as long as power holds in the winter) :) Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: ericjbrewer

customer_reviews.title: Supply Cord Not Long Enough
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be a well made product, but the amount of non-heat cord is very short. In 99% of the installations you will need to add an extension cord.
customer_reviews.author: Scrubjay

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: Used for our rv hose. Never froze. Would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: c. hop.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Easy to use & install. Cheaper & better value than Lowe's or Home Depot, I can wait a couple of days to get the item for the amount I saved! Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: BamaShugg

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: Does the job of preventing my outdoor water pipes from freezing!
customer_reviews.author: A.A.Norman Ph.D.

customer_reviews.title: Heat up sump pump discharge
customer_reviews.text: Electric bill skyrocket but sump pump line is not frozen anymore
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Slomczynski

customer_reviews.title: Very well made, work great so far
customer_reviews.text: These cables are very well made, they have been working great. Since it got cold in November I have had them running 24/7 with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: jw

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work? What gives?
customer_reviews.text: It just doesn’t work. Why would amazon sell this POS?
customer_reviews.author: amazon_lover

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Wrapped my bee hive with it for the frigid winter nights works great well made
customer_reviews.author: cms203

customer_reviews.title: keep from freezing
customer_reviews.text: Does it's job, works well, seems to last. I"d buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Reviews4U

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: It's as simple as wrapping your pipe with it taping it as you go and then put insulation over it. It's only gotten down to about 18 or 20 so far and I have the underpinning off my trailer and it's kept my pipes flowing.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Pugh

customer_reviews.title: Great for freezing temperatures
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I expected. Fast shipping. Life saver for my RV in freezing temperatures.
customer_reviews.author: Spinelli

customer_reviews.title: FAILED within ONE WEEK!
customer_reviews.text: The plug end still lights up, but it failed to heat within the first week! Be warned!
customer_reviews.author: Jill O.A.T.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked as advertised, Lasted all winter and than some. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Gill

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for what I needed it for
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for what I needed it for. Have only had to use it for a few days then unplugged it so hopefully it will last and I can use it next time NC decides to freeze over for a week
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: This has been working very well through the winter to keep my chickens with water.
customer_reviews.author: Stewart N

customer_reviews.title: Recommend this heat tape
customer_reviews.text: The price was better than local hardware store. Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Paul C. Woodward

customer_reviews.title: Keep looking
customer_reviews.text: Unhappy with this product wrapped it around the pipes indoors, following instructions. Pipes still frozen after 2 days. Would have returned if it wasn’t a pain in the butt to get back off the pipe.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua M Frankos

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: So far this seems to have solved my frozen pipe problem. I am very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mark A. Folk

customer_reviews.title: Did not work
customer_reviews.text: I tested product by immersing thermostat in cold water and the wire never heated up.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Was exactly what we needed
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Installed it the same day it arrived on the mail. Was at least $125 cheaper than the big box stores in our area.
customer_reviews.author: CMiller

customer_reviews.title: Good product!
customer_reviews.text: Works like it should but haven’t had it very long or been very cold yet.
customer_reviews.author: RMO

customer_reviews.title: Great for long runs of water pipe
customer_reviews.text: Used it to protect a long run of water pipe under an office trailer.
customer_reviews.author: JJ R

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my friend living in north as a gift to his new house. He told me it worked very well in their freezing world. It saves his pipe from freezing. Self regulating heating cable is exact what he need to keep his pipe from freezing. Excellent gift to him!
customer_reviews.author: Yang Zhang

customer_reviews.title: Good Product.
customer_reviews.text: Well made and sturdy, and I like the self regulating on/off feature. Works well.
customer_reviews.author: C. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Product was a great quality! Also shipping was of course GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: Loved the quality of this. Some are cheap made this one wasn’t, GREAT SHIPPING ALSO
customer_reviews.author: kimberly ann vermette

customer_reviews.title: Bye bye frozen pipe
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for keeping my sump pump discharge pipe from ice damming again. Wrapped the pipe AND then insulated. No more pipe blockage
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Less than 24 hour delivery
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in less than 24 hours!!! And kept our rv pipes for freezing the very next day. Couldn't be happier. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Gecias

customer_reviews.title: Didnt work. First time use.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the heat tape at the end of Jan. It is april, and I am using it for the first time. I dont believe it is working. I woke up this morning to 36 degrees and checked the heat tape. It felt as cold as the air. Now it is past the return date.
customer_reviews.author: jesse harvey

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Does everything it needs to. Used it to heat a chicken waterer. Had it since early january its feb now
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Defective part now have frozen pipes and have to do the job twice!!
customer_reviews.text: Found out the hard way today that this product is defective. Frozen pipes on the first freeze of the year. I am dreading installing this again as it is for a pipe in my crawlspace that runs the length of my home. Poor quallity control.
customer_reviews.author: BMC. U.S.A.

customer_reviews.title: works as described
customer_reviews.text: The heat wire works perfectly and works as described. Easy to install, but would not use wire ties. Plastic tape works the best.
customer_reviews.author: PokPok

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: This product does not heat up enough to thaw a frozen pipe.
customer_reviews.author: Kiki dee

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for our home in Idaho, but someone else installed it. But the problem is fixed and we’re thinking it did the trick. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Geri Bevilacqua

customer_reviews.title: A+++++
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my mom because her pipes continue to freeze. It worked great I’d suggest this product to others
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This heat tape did exactly as it is supposed to- it kept my pipes from freezing up and was easy to install!
customer_reviews.author: Ben Hockett

product_meta.title: HEATIT JHSF 12-feet 120V Self Regulating assembled Pipe Cable
feature_bullets: JHSF doesn't work unless the ambient temperature is below 37F/3 degree C. Please test the cable in a cold environment.

Suitable for use on plastic and metal water pipes.( including inlet pipe,drain pipe, sewer , palm tree frost protection etc). Self regulating heating cable output will adjust automatically based on the ambient temperature at each point along the cable.

Pre-assembled, easy to install. Including grounded plug with light, built in thermostat(turn the cable 37F on 50F off) and instructions. 120 volt, 3 watts/ft at 50 degrees F. Protect pipes up to 2" in diameter. Can be used by straight, spiral and overlap.

ETL approved. 2 ft 18/3 cold lead with plug. The lowest installation temperature of this heating cable is -10 degree C. Tough XLPE as inner insulation and weather resistant PE (high-low temperature) as out jacket. Ingress Protection 65.
Testing the cable before the installation. Uncoil the cable, plug in the heating cable. Normally you can feel the slight warm on the heating cable in few minutes.
